intro: Silene renzii, commonly known as the Hainan catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Silene renzii is considered a rare and endangered species.
